briefdescription.para: Defines maximum length of generic netlink multicast group name.
PTP traffic (EtherType = 0x88F7 or UDP dst port == 319 or UDP dst port == 320) (default packet action is drop)
PTP packet sent from CPU with updated TX timestamp (default packet action is drop)
DHCP traffic (UDP ports 67, 68) (default packet action is forward)
DHCPV6 traffic (UDP ports 546, 547) (default packet action is forward)
DHCP traffic (UDP ports 67, 68), either L3 broadcast or unicast to local router IP address (default packet action is forward)
Unknown L3 multicast packets (default packet action is drop)
Source NAT miss packets (default packet action is drop)
Destination NAT miss packets (default packet action is drop)
NAT hairpin packets (default packet action is drop)
IP packets to local router IP address (routes with SAI_ROUTE_ENTRY_ATTR_NEXT_HOP_ID = SAI_SWITCH_ATTR_CPU_PORT) (default packet action is drop)
SSH traffic (TCP dst port == 22) to local router IP address (default packet action is drop)
SNMP traffic (UDP dst port == 161) to local router IP address (default packet action is drop)
BGP traffic (TCP src port == 179 or TCP dst port == 179) to local router IP address (default packet action is drop)
BGPv6 traffic (TCP src port == 179 or TCP dst port == 179) to local router IP address (default packet action is drop)
BFD traffic (UDP dst port == 3784 or UDP dst port == 4784) to local router IP address (default packet action is drop)
BFDV6 traffic (UDP dst port == 3784 or UDP dst port == 4784) to local router IP address (default packet action is drop)

detaileddescription.para: Local IP traps custom range start

briefdescription.para: Packets size exceeds the router interface MTU size (default packet action is drop)
Packets with TTL 0 or 1 (default packet action is drop)
Packets trapped when station move is observed with static FDB entry (default packet action is drop)
Packets discarded due to egress buffer full (default packet action is drop)
Packets discarded by WRED (default packet action is drop)
Packets discarded due to router causes, such as header checksum, router interface is down, matching a route with drop action (black holes), etc. (default packet action is drop)
MPLS packets with expiring TTL value of 1 (default packet action is drop)
MPLS packet with router alert label (default packet action is forward)

detaileddescription.para: This is equivalent to ACL entry priority SAI_ACL_ENTRY_ATTR_PRIORITY.

briefdescription.para: List of SAI ports to be excluded (disabled) from the trap generation.
Trap group ID for the trap.

detaileddescription.para: When it is empty, then packet hits won't be counted

briefdescription.para: Start of user defined trap types.

detaileddescription.para: Generated by neighbor table entry hit with action trap/log, or by neighbor table miss

briefdescription.para: End of user defined trap types.
Host interface user defined trap type.

detaileddescription.para: User defined traps action is controlled by the referencing object. For example, ACL entry with packet action trap and user trap object ID

briefdescription.para: Host interface user defined trap type.

detaileddescription.para: It is valid to create multiple instances of the same user defined type

briefdescription.para: Trap priority. This is equivalent to ACL entry priority SAI_ACL_ENTRY_ATTR_PRIORITY.
Trap group ID for the trap.
Host interface user defined trap attributes.
Strip vlan tag Strip vlan tag from the incoming packet when delivering the packet to host interface.
Keep vlan tag. When incoming packet is untagged, add PVID tag to the packet when delivering the packet to host interface.
Keep the packet same as the incoming packet.

detaileddescription.para: The packet delivered to host interface is the same as the original packet. When the host interface is PORT and LAG, the packet delivered to host interface is the same as the original packet seen by the PORT and LAG. When the host interface is VLAN, the packet delivered to host interface will not have tag.

Port netdev will be created when object type is SAI_OBJECT_TYPE_PORT LAG netdev will be created when object type is SAI_OBJECT_TYPE_LAG VLAN netdev will be created when object type is SAI_OBJECT_TYPE_VLAN System Port netdev will be created when object type is SAI_OBJECT_TYPE_SYSTEM_PORT
The maximum number of characters for the name is SAI_HOSTIF_NAME_SIZE - 1 since it needs the terminating null byte ('\0') at the end.
If Hostif is a generic netlink, this indicates the generic netlink family name.

briefdescription.para: Set the operational status for this host interface.
Set the queue index to be used for packets going out through this interface.
Strip/keep vlan tag for received packet.

detaileddescription.para: The maximum number of characters for the name is SAI_HOSTIF_GENETLINK_MCGRP_NAME_SIZE - 1 Set the Generic netlink multicast group name on which the packets/buffers are received on this host interface
LAG based Host Interface entry Type
Vlan based Host Interface entry Type
Receive packets via Linux netdev type port
Receive packets via Linux netdev logical port (LAG or port)
Receive packets via Linux netdev L3 interface
Receive packets via Linux generic netlink interface

briefdescription.para: Host interface table entry match field object-id.

detaileddescription.para: Should be port object when type is SAI_HOSTIF_TABLE_ENTRY_TYPE_PORT. Should be LAG object when type is SAI_HOSTIF_TABLE_ENTRY_TYPE_LAG. Should be VLAN ID object when type is SAI_HOSTIF_TABLE_ENTRY_TYPE_VLAN.

simplesect.title: Condition:
simplesect.para: @@condition SAI_HOSTIF_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_TYPE == SAI_HOSTIF_TABLE_ENTRY_TYPE_PORT or SAI_HOSTIF_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_TYPE == SAI_HOSTIF_TABLE_ENTRY_TYPE_VLAN or SAI_HOSTIF_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_TYPE == SAI_HOSTIF_TABLE_ENTRY_TYPE_LAG

briefdescription.para: Host interface table entry match field trap-id.

simplesect.title: Condition:
simplesect.para: @@condition SAI_HOSTIF_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_TYPE == SAI_HOSTIF_TABLE_ENTRY_TYPE_PORT or SAI_HOSTIF_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_TYPE == SAI_HOSTIF_TABLE_ENTRY_TYPE_VLAN or SAI_HOSTIF_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_TYPE == SAI_HOSTIF_TABLE_ENTRY_TYPE_LAG or SAI_HOSTIF_TABLE_ENTRY_ATTR_TYPE == SAI_HOSTIF_TABLE_ENTRY_TYPE_TRAP_ID

briefdescription.para: Host interface table entry action channel.
Host interface table entry action target host interface object.
Host interface table entry attribute IDs.
Bypass switch ASIC processing pipeline, tx packet goes to the specified output port directly.

detaileddescription.para: TX packet goes to the switch ASIC processing pipeline to decide the output port

For receive case, filled with the egress destination port for unicast packets. Egress LAG member port id to be filled for the LAG destination case. Applicable for use-case like samplepacket traps or PTP TX event
The .1D or .1Q bridge on which the packet was received.
The timestamp on which the packet was received, or sent for PTP TX event.
The egress queue id for egress port or LAG.

briefdescription.para: Flag to convey that buffer passed to sai_send_hostif_packet_fn can be used directly and does not need to be copied over.

memberdef.definition: typedef sai_status_t(* sai_recv_hostif_packet_fn) (_In_ sai_object_id_t hostif_id, _Inout_ sai_size_t *buffer_size, _Out_ void *buffer, _Inout_ uint32_t *attr_count, _Out_ sai_attribute_t *attr_list)
memberdef.argsstring: )(_In_ sai_object_id_t hostif_id, _Inout_ sai_size_t *buffer_size, _Out_ void *buffer, _Inout_ uint32_t *attr_count, _Out_ sai_attribute_t *attr_list)
memberdef.name: sai_recv_hostif_packet_fn

parameterdescription.para: Allocated buffer size [in], Actual packet size in bytes [out]
Allocated list size [in], Number of attributes [out]

simplesect.para: SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS on success SAI_STATUS_BUFFER_OVERFLOW if buffer_size is insufficient, and buffer_size will be filled with required size. Or if attr_count is insufficient, and attr_count will be filled with required count. Failure status code on error

memberdef.definition: typedef sai_status_t(* sai_send_hostif_packet_fn) (_In_ sai_object_id_t hostif_id, _In_ sai_size_t buffer_size, _In_ const void *buffer, _In_ uint32_t attr_count, _In_ const sai_attribute_t *attr_list)
memberdef.argsstring: )(_In_ sai_object_id_t hostif_id, _In_ sai_size_t buffer_size, _In_ const void *buffer, _In_ uint32_t attr_count, _In_ const sai_attribute_t *attr_list)
memberdef.name: sai_send_hostif_packet_fn

parameterdescription.para: Host interface id. When sending through FD channel, fill SAI_OBJECT_TYPE_HOST_INTERFACE object, of type SAI_HOSTIF_TYPE_FD. When sending through CB channel, fill Switch Object ID, SAI_OBJECT_TYPE_SWITCH.

simplesect.para: SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS on success, failure status code on error

memberdef.definition: typedef sai_status_t(* sai_allocate_hostif_packet_fn) (_In_ sai_object_id_t hostif_id, _In_ sai_size_t buffer_size, _Out_ void **buffer, _In_ uint32_t attr_count, _In_ const sai_attribute_t *attr_list)
memberdef.argsstring: )(_In_ sai_object_id_t hostif_id, _In_ sai_size_t buffer_size, _Out_ void **buffer, _In_ uint32_t attr_count, _In_ const sai_attribute_t *attr_list)
memberdef.name: sai_allocate_hostif_packet_fn

parameterdescription.para: Host interface id. When sending through FD channel, fill SAI_OBJECT_TYPE_HOST_INTERFACE object, of type SAI_HOSTIF_TYPE_FD. When sending through CB channel, fill Switch Object ID, SAI_OBJECT_TYPE_SWITCH. On sending such packets (say via the sai_send_hostif_packet_fn) application should set SAI_HOSTIF_PACKET_ATTR_ZERO_COPY_TX attribute to true

simplesect.para: SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS on success, failure status code on error

parameterdescription.para: Host interface id. When sending through FD channel, fill SAI_OBJECT_TYPE_HOST_INTERFACE object, of type SAI_HOSTIF_TYPE_FD. When sending through CB channel, fill Switch Object ID, SAI_OBJECT_TYPE_SWITCH.

simplesect.para: SAI_STATUS_SUCCESS on success, failure status code on error

memberdef.definition: typedef struct _sai_hostif_api_t sai_hostif_api_t
memberdef.name: sai_hostif_api_t

briefdescription.para: Hostif methods table retrieved with sai_api_query()
This module defines SAI host interface.

detaileddescription.para: Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain a copy of the License at http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0

THIS CODE IS PROVIDED ON AN AS IS BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, EITHER EXPRESS OR IMPLIED, INCLUDING WITHOUT LIMITATION ANY IMPLIED WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF TITLE, FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE, MERCHANTABILITY OR NON-INFRINGEMENT.
See the Apache Version 2.0 License for specific language governing permissions and limitations under the License.

Microsoft would like to thank the following companies for their review and assistance with these files: Intel Corporation, Mellanox Technologies Ltd, Dell Products, L.P., Facebook, Inc., Marvell International Ltd.

Abstract
This module defines SAI Host Interface which is responsible for creating/deleting Linux netdev corresponding to the host interface type. All the management operations of the netdevs such as changing IP address are outside the scope of SAI.
